material.mattext:
Males' height (X) follows (approximately) a normal distribution with mean of 69 inches and standard deviation 2.8. Using R find: (a) What proportion of males are less than 65 inches tall? (What is P(X < 65)?) (b) What proportion of males are more than 75 inches tall? (What is P(X > 75)?) (c) What proportion of males are between 66 and 72 inches tall? (What is
P(66 < X < 72)?)

(a) R provides: > pnorm(65, mean=69, sd=2.8) [1] 0.07656373
So roughly 7.65% of males are less than 65 inches tall.
(b) R provides: > 1 − pnorm(75, mean=69, sd=2.8) [1] 0.01606229
So roughly 1.6% of males are more than 75 inches tall. (c) R provides:
> pnorm(72, mean=69, sd=2.8) − pnorm(66, mean=69, sd=2.8) [1] 0.7160232
So roughly 71.6% of males are between 66 and 72 inches tall.
